data.question: What is the chemical formula for PCN-808?
What method was used for the photocatalytic activity tests?
data.answer: The photocatalytic activity tests were conducted using a flame-dried 4 mL vial equipped with a magnetic stir bar, adding Ru(bpy)3Cl2 or PCN-808-BDBR, tetrahydroisoquinoline derivative, and nitromethane, and stirring at room temperature under 450 nm LED lamp in open air.

data.question: Is the linker ratio of TPTB:BPDC in PCN-808-BPDC approximately 1:1 according to 1H NMR spectroscopy?
What is the yield of PCN-808 when synthesized?
How was the linker H2BDBR synthesized?
data.answer: H2BDBR was synthesized according to a literature procedure.

data.question: What is the crystal system of PCN-808?
Can the hydrogen atoms for the coordinated molecules in MOFs be found from the residual electron density peaks?
What was the temperature used for activation of samples before N2 sorption measurements?
Was the linker ratio of TPTB:BDBR in PCN-808-BDBR about 8:3 according to 1H NMR spectra?
What was the space group of PCN-808-BDBR?
Did the photocatalytic activity of PCN-808-BDBR for the aza-Henry reaction retain a value of 93% after six cycles?
What was the method used to confirm the phase purity and compositions of the multicomponent MOFs?
data.answer: Powder X-ray diffraction patterns of activated samples and 1H NMR spectra of digested samples were measured.

data.question: Was the linker installation method used for introducing and precisely placing functional groups into MOFs under mild conditions?

Did the photocatalytic oxidation of dihydroartemisinic acid to artemisinin use PCN-808-BDBR as a catalyst?
